column4: um, after i boot from the cd and choose to install/live boot from the cd and then i get a "*preparing restricted drivers..." then nothing happens
do you have an ati card
i dont know, im new to this whole linux thing
whats the problem
the install wont work and i partitioned the drive with 1012mb of swap and the rest with ext3 like TheGateKeeper said and i tried installing and it wont work.
i get a ubuntu screen with a bunch of stuff OK'ed at the bottom, then i get a black screen with preparing restricted something
run the cd checker
when you boot it there is an option to check media
boot from the cd and look at the menu options
why would there be defects, i just got the cd today in the mail
I don't know - just check it
have you done the media check
yesh, and its clean
na, its done
its draper drake
look at the boot options, try some of the safe modes
I told you to install from safe/recovery mode
i dont know how to do that if you dont tell me
I did - look at the boot options from the cd
ok, there is start, safe graphics check memory and boot hd
i tried the starrt, i get a freeze, then i tried safe, i get a freeze, i checked for defects, its clean, i did a memory test, its fine, i bootted from hd, theres nothing there
so what now?
got to be honest, I'm losing interest. If its freezing, sounds like a hardware error
